title: Can't convert an e-mail to a calendar event
content:
Can't convert an e-mail to a calendar event

This was never a problem until the latest Thunderbird update. I click on an e-mail to highlight it. I right click and a menu shows up, as usual. There is an entry on that menu "convert to", as usual. I choose "event" and nothing happens. I used to get a box that let me choose a reminder date and when to be reminded. Now nothing comes up. Is there a Lightning update that is now missing?

Thank you, Ken

title: Deleting unopened emails
content: With Thunderbird update 115.5.2(64 bit) I cannot delete about one half of my unopened (unwanted) emails. When several new emails appear in my inbox I see several emails that I do not want to open. I right click on one I do not want and select 'Delete message' the message goes to Trash and the next email opens automatically. I want to open only emails I pick out not unwanted ones. Before the latest Thunderbird update I was to delete any email without any other email opening automatically. Can you help me? Thank you. nomad1955@centurylink.net

title: The Tabs in Thunderbird 115 extend across the screen and into nowhere.  They appear to be metres long
content:
The T'bird 115 with tabs has caused my problem. With 115.5.2 every email in my inbox and deleted box have been tabbed and extend for a huge number across the screen to the righthand side. Many have multiple copies of each email. Using web advice to turn off tabs which suggests use TOOLS / Options /Tabs to turn off tabs. There is no Options in my TOOLS drop down. Another solution is to right click in a space in the Tab bar then click Customise then look for the Tabs option. The Customise tool only gives option to add more buttons to the menu bar. I have avoided going back to an earlier version as I am worried I might lose information in the folders that I have created for important emails (ie insurance, warranties etc). I thought the Tabs was a good idea but it is not working for me. I would appreciate any suggestions.

Peter
